**<sub><sub>![P2 Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/P2-yellow?style=flat)</sub></sub>  Detect ABI version without requiring calibrate symbol**

The harness sets `abi_version` to 2 whenever `cortex_calibrate` is absent, but ABI v3 allows stateless kernels that do not export `cortex_calibrate` (see `docs/architecture/abi_v3_specification.md` section â€œv3 kernel with missing cortex_calibrate symbolâ€). For those kernels compiled with `CORTEX_ABI_VERSION == 3`, this code will pass `abi_version = 2`, causing `cortex_init()` to reject the config and preventing the kernel from running. Consider a different v3/v2 detection strategy (e.g., a dedicated symbol or attempting v3 first and falling back on failure) so stateless v3 kernels can initialize correctly.
